result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam N Quintana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any AODA, treatment per agent.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of intoxicated beverages.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam N Quintana in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to revoke DPA.  Parties stipulate to revoking DPA.  Court is satisfied DPA to be revoked and grants motion.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:

18 mos. probation, may transfer/serve in Illinois
AODA/treatment per agent
Absolute Sobriety
No entry into taverns, bars, club or estabilshments that the main purpose of sale is intoxicated beverages
$556.33 extradition costs
$518.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Provide DNA Sample
Paperwork handed in court.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam N Quintana appeared by phone means. Court reviews financial information.  Court appoints Attorney Phillip Stammen @$65/hr @ $75.00/month commencing 11/1/17.
Indigency hearing on September 28, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Motion hearing on October 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Adam N Quintana by video from LEC with attorney David J Susens.  Defendant Adam N Quintana in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Susens notes it's a motion to revoke a DPA.  State notes a warrant was issued.  Court advises DE of right to counsel.  Atty Susens states DE doesn't qualify for PD appt but he was provided indigency paperwork.  Court advises DE of indigency process.  Atty Susens explains why DE didn't appear for the motion hearing.  State requests previous bond be reinstated.  Atty Susens responds/provides new address.  Requests bond currently in place be reinstated.  State requests RD be set as soon as possible.  Court orders previous $2,000.00 signature bond reinstated.  Matter set for new MH.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
